00020 ;FILE DESCRIPTION:
00021 ;  This file contains A/D set up and interrupt service routines for
00022 ;  the dsPIC30F processor. These routines may be use to convert analog
00023 ;  signals provided by the potentiometer and the temperature sensor
00024 ;  on the dsPICDEM2 development board.
00025 ;
00026 ;REVISION HISTORY:
00027 ;  $Log: A_to_D_Converter.c,v $
00028 ;  Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/06 09:16:45  VasukiH
00029 ;  First release of software
00030 ;
00031 ;
00032 */
00033 
00034 //Pre-Processor Directives:
00035 #include <p30fxxxx.h>
00036 #include "system.h"
00037 #include "ConversionAN.h"
00038 
00039 int TempSensor = 0;
00040 int Potentiometer = 0;
00041 
00042 //Functions:
00043 
00044 //ADC_Init() is used to configure A/D to scan and convert 2 input channels
00045 //per interrupt. The A/D is set up for a total sampling rate of 8KHz
00046 //or 4KHz per channel. The internal counter in the A/D is used to provide
00047 //Acquisition time delay. The input pins being scanned are AN2 and AN3.
00048 //AN2 and AN3 are connected to the Temperature Sensor and the Potentiometer
00049 //on the dsPICDEM2 board.
00050 void ADC_Init(void)
00051 {
00052         //ADCON1 Register
00053         //Set up A/D for Automatic Sampling, Auto-Convert
00054         //All other bits to their default state
00055         ADCON1bits.SSRC = 7;
00056         ADCON1bits.ASAM = 1;
00057 
00058         //ADCON2 Register
00059         //Set up A/D for interrupting after 2 samples get filled in the buffer
00060         //Also, enable Channel scanning
00061         //All other bits to their default state
00062         ADCON2bits.SMPI = 1;
00063         ADCON2bits.CSCNA = 1;
00064 
00065         //ADCON3 Register
00066         //Set up Acquisition time (Tacq) for 31 Tad periods
00067         //where, Tad = A/D conversion clock time.
00068         //Set up Tad period to be 20.5 Tcy (Tcy = instruction cycle time)
00069         //Given that each conversion takes 14*Tad (=Tconv) periods,
00070         //Total Sample Time = Acquisition Time + Conversion Time
00071         // = (31 + 14)*Tad = 45*Tad periods
00072         // = 45 * 20.5 * Tcy = 922.5*Tcy periods
00073         //At 7.3728 MIPS, Tcy = 135 ns = Instruction Cycle Time
00074         //So Tsamp = Tacq + Tconv = 45*Tad(in this example)= 125.1 microseconds
00075         //So Fsamp = Sampling Rate ~= 8 KHz
00076         //All other bits to their default state
00077         ADCON3bits.SAMC = 31;
00078         ADCON3bits.ADCS = 40;
00079 
00080         //ADCHS Register
00081         //When Channel scanning is enabled (ADCON2bits.CSCNA=1)
00082         //AND Alternate mux sampling is disabled (ADCON2bits.ALTS=0)
00083         //then ADCHS is a "don't care"
00084         ADCHS = 0x0000;
00085 
00086         //ADCSSL Register
00087         //Scan channels AN2, AN3 fas part of scanning sequence
00088         ADCSSL = 0x000C;
00089 
00090         //ADPCFG Register
00091         //Set up channels AN2, AN3 as analog inputs and leave rest as digital
00092         //Recall that we configured all A/D pins as digital when code execution
00093         //entered main() out of reset
00094         ADPCFGbits.PCFG2 = 0;
00095         ADPCFGbits.PCFG3 = 0;
00096 
00097         //Clear the A/D interrupt flag bit
00098         IFS0bits.ADIF = 0;
00099 
00100         //Set the A/D interrupt enable bit
00101         IEC0bits.ADIE = 1;
00102 
00103         //Turn on the A/D converter
00104         //This is typically done after configuring other registers
00105         ADCON1bits.ADON = 1;
00106 
00107 }
00108 
00109 //_ADCInterrupt() is the A/D interrupt service routine (ISR).
00110 //The routine must have global scope in order to be an ISR.
00111 //The ISR name is chosen from the device linker script.
00112 void __attribute__((__interrupt__, __no_auto_psv__)) _ADCInterrupt(void)
00113 {
00114         //Copy the A/D conversion results from ADCBUFn to variables-
00115         //"Potentiometer" and "TempSensor".
00116         //Since ADCON2bits.SMPI = 1, only the first two (i.e. SMPI+1) ADCBUFn
00117         //locations are used by the module to store conversion results
00118         Potentiometer = ADCBUF0;
00119         TempSensor = ADCBUF1;
00120 
00121         //Clear the A/D Interrupt flag bit or else the CPU will
00122         //keep vectoring back to the ISR
00123         IFS0bits.ADIF = 0;
00124 
00125 }
